thread.title: Premier yarn demand boosts Unifi FY
thread.title_full: Premier yarn demand boosts Unifi FY

title: Premier yarn demand boosts Unifi FY
text:
FY net income reaches US$42.2m Gross profit improves to 13.2% Sales flat at $687.1m 
Yarn manufacturer Unifi booked a strong performance for its full-year thanks to increased demand for its premier value-added yarns, and strong results from its international businesses. 
Net income for the year ended 28 June reached US$42.2m from $28.8m a year earlier, thanks to improved operating results for the company's global operations, along with a lower effective tax rate. 
Unifi said higher sales volumes were recorded as a result of increased regional demand for textured polyester and nylon yarns in North and Central America as well as improvements in Brazil and China. 
Gross profit improved to 13.2% from 12.1% in the prior fiscal year, while net sales remained flat at $687.1m due to the devaluation of the Brazilian Real and lower sales prices. 
&quotWe expect that our domestic business will begin to see in fiscal year 2016 the benefits of the strategic capital projects that were completed in the 2015 fiscal year, including the addition of texturing machines to support the growth in demand for synthetic yarns from the CAFTA region, as well as the expansion of our air jet texturing capacity," said COO Roger Berrier. &quotWe also expect to start seeing the benefits of the recently announced expansions of our Repreve Recycling Center and the backward integration into bottle processing as we enter into our 2017 fiscal year."
